## ðŸ§¬ Biotech & Longevity 2026

**Full report:** `research/2026-03-01-biotech-longevity-2026-ai-drug-discovery-glp1-gene-therapy-crispr.md` (16.6KB)

The framing: a **$176B patent cliff** hitting Big Pharma through 2030 is the engine underneath everything â€” M&A frenzy, AI adoption urgency, pipeline acceleration. Every trend in biotech right now traces back to that number.

**The signals that matter:**

- **AI drug discovery goes clinical.** Isomorphic Labs (DeepMind spin-out) claims 2Ã— AlphaFold3 performance on protein-ligand binding. Insilico Medicine's AI-designed IPF drug is in Phase 2 â€” the first AI-originated small molecule to get there. This isn't hype anymore; it's Phase 2 data.

- **GLP-1 oral race is on.** Eli Lilly's orforglipron enters Phase 3 as the front-runner for a once-daily oral GLP-1. The injection-to-pill transition unlocks a vastly larger addressable market â€” convenience is the final barrier to mass adoption.

- **Gene therapy is scaling (slowly).** 46+ FDA CGT approvals on the books. Casgevy (Vertex/CRISPR Therapeutics) â€” the first approved CRISPR therapy â€” begins commercial scale-up. Intellia's in vivo CRISPR program enters Phase 3. The platform is proven; manufacturing and cost are the bottlenecks.

- **Radiopharmaceuticals: the quiet winner.** Aktis Oncology raised $318M in one of the largest oncology rounds of the year. Targeted alpha/beta therapy is seeing serious capital. Under-covered vs the AI/GLP-1 hype.

- **Longevity startups with real money.** Altos Labs ($3B+ raised, Caltech/Cambridge labs), Calico (Google/AbbVie JV), BioAge (GLP-1 + longevity combo trials), NewLimit (Andreessen Horowitz backed). Epigenetic clocks (Horvath, GrimAge, DunedinPACE) are the measurement layer these companies are building against.

**The question to watch:** Can AI drug discovery compress Phase 1â†’2â†’3 timelines enough to outrun the patent cliff? The 2026â€“2028 window will produce the first real answer.

## ðŸŒ± Green Tech & Climate AI 2026

**Full report:** `research/2026-03-01-green-tech-climate-ai-2026-solar-battery-nuclear-smr-ev-energy-nexus.md` (14.5KB)

The framing: clean energy crossed from "policy-dependent" to **economically inevitable**. The cost curves are so steep that regulation is now a secondary factor â€” the market will decarbonize the grid regardless of which administration is in power.

**The signals that matter:**

- **Battery storage: $70/kWh.** New all-time record low (BloombergNEF LCOE 2026). Stationary storage is now the *cheapest* clean power segment â€” cheaper than solar, wind, geothermal, nuclear on a per-kWh basis. This is the inflection point that makes solar+storage the default for new builds.

- **BESS surged 29% YoY.** 57 GWh / 28 GW of battery energy storage installed in the US in 2025. California, Texas, Arizona leading. Utilities are no longer piloting â€” they're deploying at scale.

- **The AI-energy paradox.** AI data centers are driving up electricity prices in 39 of 50 US states. The same hyperscalers causing the problem are buying the most clean power. In 2026, the conversation has shifted from *sourcing* clean power to *decoupling from the grid entirely* â€” on-site solar + BESS to avoid exposure to volatile wholesale prices.

- **Nuclear SMR: real momentum, not-yet-real power.** >$1B in SMR startup rounds in Q4 2025. Google signed a PPA with Kairos Power. Microsoft restarted Three Mile Island. But commercial SMR electricity is 2029â€“2035. Near-term data center power = solar + batteries.

- **Hydrogen: painful reset.** Hundreds of billions in announced projects quietly shelved. Investors now demanding bankable offtake contracts and infrastructure clarity before committing. Green hydrogen is still strategic (shipping, aviation, fertilisers) but the timeline extended significantly.

- **Emerging battery chemistries.** Three to watch: solid-state (Toyota targeting 2027â€“28 production vehicle), sodium-ion (CATL, no lithium/cobalt/nickel, abundant feedstock), iron-air (Form Energy, 100-hour grid storage, $400M+ raised). Each solves a different problem.

- **Geopolitics.** China manufactures ~80% of global solar panels and dominates battery supply chains. Brent forecast $59/bbl in 2026 (-$10 vs 2025). LNG entering long-duration price slump as US/Qatar supply ramps. Copper outperforms on electrification demand.

**The question to watch:** Does solid-state battery hit Toyota's 2027â€“28 production target? If yes, EV-to-ICE price parity becomes unavoidable in the mass market.
